verses.text: 因拜偶像而榮華盡失從前以法蓮一說話，人都戰兢。他原在以色列中居高位，但後來因事奉巴力犯了罪，就死了。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Often used in classical or religious contexts.
Used before a verb to denote immediacy.
Often found in formal or religious contexts.
Often implies reverent service, especially to a deity.
A Canaanite deity.
A verb-object compound with aspect particle.

verses.text: 現在他們犯罪越來越多，為自己做鑄像，按著自己的技巧，用自己的銀子做偶像；這些都是匠人的手工。他們論到這些說：「向偶像獻祭的人，可以與牛犢親吻。」

words.note: Refers specifically to idols made by casting metal.
Turns preceding phrase into a noun phrase.
More formal/biblical than 小牛.

verses.text: 因此，他們必像早晨的雲霧，又如易逝的朝露，又像打穀場上的糠秕被旋風吹去，又像煙氣從煙窗上騰。

words.note: Literally 'easily pass away'.
Poetic and often used to describe fragility/brevity.
Refers to husks or worthless parts of grain.
More formal or literary than 升起.

verses.text: 因驕傲而忘記主「自從你出埃及地以來，我就是耶和華你的 神。除我以外，你不可承認別的神；除我以外，再沒有拯救者。

words.note: A title for God or Jesus.
Egypt (埃及) plus land (地).
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Capitalized when referring to the one God.
Lowercase when referring to deities in general, not the one God.

verses.text: 我曾在曠野，在乾旱之地，認識你。

words.note: Classical equivalent of modern '的'.

verses.text: 但他們得了餵養而飽足，飽足以後，就心高氣傲，因此忘記了我。

words.note: An idiom describing haughtiness.

verses.text: 所以我要像獅子臨到他們，像豹子埋伏在路旁。

words.definition: to come upon, to arrive at
to ambush, to lie in wait

verses.text: 我要襲擊他們，像一隻失掉幼熊的母熊，撕裂他們的胸膛；在那裡我必像一隻母獅吞吃他們；野獸必撕裂他們。
必受極重的刑罰「以色列啊，我要毀滅你，誰能幫助你呢（本節在《馬索拉文本》的意思不明確；現參照《七十士譯本》和其他古譯本翻譯）？
現在你的王在哪裡？讓他拯救你吧！你所有的領袖在哪裡？讓他們治理你吧！因為論到他們你曾請求：『把王和領袖賜給我。』

words.note: Lit. 'the one who leads the sleeves (of a crowd)'
Lit. 'the one who leads the sleeves (of a crowd)'

verses.text: 我在忿怒中把王賜給你，又在烈怒中把他廢去。

words.note: Often used as a postposition with 在
Introduces direct object before verb

verses.text: 以法蓮的罪孽是封著的，他的罪惡貯藏起來。

words.note: 著 indicates continuous or sustained state
Used after an adjective/verb phrase to form a nominal expression
Indicates completion or accumulation

verses.text: 生產的疼痛要臨到他身上，他卻是沒有智慧的人，因為產期到了，他還遲延不破胎而出。

words.note: Used to denote location on a person
Used after an adjective/verb phrase to form a nominal expression
Connects clauses, often indicating consequence

verses.text: 我要救贖他們脫離陰間的權勢嗎？救贖他們脫離死亡嗎？死亡啊，你的災害在哪裡？陰間啊，你的毀滅在哪裡？憐憫必從我眼前隱藏起來。

words.note: Personified here as a being
Indicates completion or upward/outward movement

verses.text: 他雖然在蘆葦中長得茂盛，但東風必要來到，耶和華的風要從曠野上來，他的水泉就乾涸，他的泉源就枯竭。他所貯藏的一切珍貴器皿，都被掠奪去了。

words.note: 得 connects a verb with its complement describing result or manner
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase
Connects an attribute to a noun
Used as directional complement indicating removal

verses.text: 撒瑪利亞必承擔自己罪的刑罰，因為他背叛了他的 神。他們必倒在刀下。他們的嬰孩被摔死，他們的孕婦必被剖開肚腹。」

words.note: Commonly 'crime' in general, but 'sin' in religious context.
Often used in legal or religious contexts.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English.
Figurative for being killed in battle or by execution.
More formal than 肚子 (dùzi).
Specifically refers to a verse in scripture.
Refers to the authoritative Hebrew text of the Old Testament.
